intro: Oplismenus compositus, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow inflorescences that are visually striking and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Oplismenus compositus typically grows in wet or moist habitats, including swamps, marshes, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
